职业化（Professionalization）的定义一直是一个颇具争议的问题，职业化作为一个长期、复杂的社会工程，目前尚无一个公认的标准。
十九世纪是专业主义(Professionalism)在欧洲开始发展的时代，任何专业都以「科学化」自命，所以在战争领域中也不例外。

encyclopedia.content: professional，意译为“职业的；专业的”，常被许多软件产品作为后缀，意即“专业版”，如Windows XP Professional，即Windows XP专业版。 professional a. 1. 职业（上）的；从事特定专业的[Z] 2. 职业性的，非业余性的[Z] 3. 很内行的；极称职的；高水平的 a highly professional administrator 一位非常内行的管理人员 4. 【贬】以。..为业的，擅长。..的 He is a professional complainer. 他是一个发牢骚专家。 n.[C] 1. 职

entry.def: Professional means relating to a person's work, especially work that requires special training.

example.ex: His professional career started at Liverpool University.
example.tran: 他的职业生涯是从利物浦大学开始的。

entry.def: Professional people have jobs that require advanced education or training.

example.ex: ...highly qualified professional people like doctors and engineers.
example.tran: 像医生和工程师这样需要高技能的专业人员

entry.def: You use professional to describe people who do a particular thing to earn money rather than as a hobby.

example.ex: This has been my worst time for injuries since I started as a professional footballer...
example.tran: 这是我当职业足球运动员以来受伤来得最不是时候的一次。

example.ex: Jack Nicklaus has played in every Major Championship since he turned professional in 1961.
example.tran: 杰克·尼克劳斯自从1961年转为职业选手以来参加了四大赛的所有比赛。

entry.def: Professional sports are played for money rather than as a hobby.

example.ex: ...an art student who had played professional football for a short time.
example.tran: 踢过短时间职业足球的艺术系学生

entry.tran: 专业的；内行的；高水平的
entry.def: If you say that something that someone does or produces is professional, you approve of it because you think that it is of a very high standard.

example.ex: They run it with  a truly professional but personal touch.
example.tran: 他们的经营既有真正的专业水准又不乏个人特色。

means.word_mean: 1. a person engaged in one of the learned professions
2. an athlete who plays for pay
3. an authority qualified to teach apprentices
1. engaged in a profession or engaging in as a profession or means of livelihood;

sentences.sentence: "the professional man or woman possesses distinctive qualifications"
"began her professional career after the Olympics"

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to or suitable as a profession;
3. characteristic of or befitting a profession or one engaged in a profession;
4. of or relating to a profession;
5. engaged in by members of a profession;

sentences.sentence: "professional occupations include medicine and the law and teaching"

pro前+fess说+or人→在前面说话的人→教师

Sentence.sentence: Next, consider eBay, Having started out as a peer-to-peer marketplace, it is now dominated by professional "power sellers" ( many of whom started out as ordinary eBay users)

ledge economy where professional roles change rapidly and many college students are preparing for positions that may not even exist yet, the skill set needed is one that prepares them for change and continued learning
People have to receive higher education to qualify for a professional position.
She was astonished by the professional possibilities afforded to young American woman.
American women who choose to be employed are far more likely to work full-time and to hold high-level jobs as manangers or professionals.

sentences.cn: 那位足球运动员故意犯规。
